channel.title: How do i make a object give you an item?
channel.description:
Ok i added a chest and i want it to give 5 different items everytime. kind of like a lottery but u win a prize everytime
Items:Rope,Guthanhelm,rune plate,dragon scimitar,blue partyhat.
How?

item.title: How do i make a object give you an item?
item.dc:creator: @Jordiescape Jordiescape
item.description:
@Jordiescape wrote:

You can “slap” a int down anywhere and it will work, just not the void I gave.

Read full topic
item.source: How do i make a object give you an item?

item.title: How do i make a object give you an item?
item.dc:creator: @lesterknome lesterknome
item.description:
@lesterknome wrote:

[quote=“Epic Ancient, post:9, topic:306364”][quote author=Jordiescape link=topic=402524.msg2982489#msg2982489 date=1254692257]
Yes it is, add it where you want the random item to be given.
[/quote]

Not the Int part, silly. ^^"

You can’t just slap an int down anywhere and hope it works. (often :P)[/quote]

Yes you can make a method anywhere and call it from a lot of places.

Read full topic

item.title: How do i make a object give you an item?
item.dc:creator: @lesterknome lesterknome
item.description:
@lesterknome wrote:

[quote=“Epic Ancient, post:5, topic:306364”][quote author=lesterknome link=topic=402524.msg2982469#msg2982469 date=1254691341]

public int[] itemsToRecieve = { ####, ####, ####, ####, #### }; public int randomItem() { return itemsToRecieve[(int) (Math.random() * itemsToRecieve.length)]; }
To get the item:

addItem(randomItem(), AMOUNT);

Nicely done
[/quote]

He didn’t really explain to him where to place it entirely.[/quote]

At least he did it right.

Jordiescape:

Doesn’t need explaining, common sense.

No its not.

Read full topic

item.source: How do i make a object give you an item?

item.title: How do i make a object give you an item?
item.dc:creator: @Epic_Ancient Epic Ancient
item.description:
@Epic_Ancient wrote:

case ####: // Description to find later easily addItem(954, 1); { sendMessage("You win an item from the Lottery Chest!"); break; } else { addItem(4724, 1); sendMessage("You win an item from the Lottery Chest!"); break; } else { addItem(1127, 1); sendMessage("You win an item from the Lottery Chest!"); break; } else { addItem(4587, 1); sendMessage("You win an item from the Lottery Chest!"); break; } else { addItem(1042, 1); sendMessage("You win an item from the Lottery Chest!"); break; }

Items: Rope, Guthan’s Helm, Rune Platebody, Dragon Scimitar, Blue Partyhat. All x1

The #### after the case is the Chest ID you want.

When they click it, they’ll get 1 of the items.

If it doesn’t work, reply to me. (I might test this out as I never thought of a thing like this :P)

Read full topic
item.source: How do i make a object give you an item?
